paper_title.en: Anti-tomor-promoting effecti of isoflavonoids on Epstein-Borr virus activction and Awo-stoge mouse skin eorcinogenesis
Inhibitory effect of soybean hypocotyls on Epstein-Barr virus early antigen induction and skin tumor promotion

description.en: The in vitro anti-tumor promoting effect of hypocotyls from fresh soybeans was evaluated. The dimethyl sulfoxide extracts of hypocotyls showed a stronger inhibitory effect than that of soybeans on Epstein-Barr virus early antigen activation induced by 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate. Daidzin, an isoflavone with the highest content of hypocotyls, was also inhibitory. An in vivo evaluation of anti-tumor promoting activity of hypocotyls against the skin of mice also revealed a significant inhibitory effect on tumor formation. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science Ireland Ltd.

paper_title.en: Anti-tumor promoting activities of lantadenes on mouse skin tumors and mouse hepatic tumors

description.en: Two-stage carcinogenesis of mouse skin papillomas induced by 7,12-dimethylbenz[o]anthracene and 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol 13-acetate, and mouse hepatic tumors induced by N-nitrosodiethylamine and phenobarbital, were inhibited by lantadenes.

paper_title.en: Quassinoids as inhibitors of Epstein-Barr virus early antigen activation

description.en: Short-term in vitro assays for tumor promoters and antitumor promoters (Epstein-Barr virus activation test) were carried out for 14 quassinoids isolated from Ailanthus altissima. Some quassinoids, including ailantinol B, ailantinol C, ailanthone, and shinjulactone A, showed moderate activity at a molar ratio of 1:100 (TPA/quassinoids), and the results led to the elucidation of structure-activity relationships. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science Ireland Ltd.

paper_title.en: Inhibitory effect of quassinoids devivatives on Epstein-Barr virus early antigen activation
Anti-tumor promoting activities of eroflavouvids from Wistaria brachy hotrys
Inhibitory effect on Epstein-Barr virus activation of anthraquinones : correlate with redox potentials
Inhibition of TPA inclucel Epstein-Barr virus early antigen activition by notoral colorants
Anti tumor promoting effects of naphthoquinones derivatives on short-term Epstein-Barr virus early antigen actutin assyed mouse skin carcirgens
Trichothecinols A, B and C, potent anti-tumor promoting sesquiterpenoids from the fungus Trichothecium roseum

description.en: Three new trichothecenes, trichothecinols A (1), B (2) and C (3) were isolated from the fungus Trichothecium roseum and unambiguiously characterized on the basis of spectroscopic and chemical evidence. These exhibited potent inhibitory effects on Epstein-Barr virus early antigen (EBV-EA) activation induced by the tumor promoter 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate (TPA). Copyright (C) 1996 Elsevier Science Ltd

paper_title.en: Anti-tumor promoting activity of Dryopteris phlorophenone derivatives

description.en: As a part of screening studies for cancer chemopreventive agents (anti-tumor promoters) 33 Dryopteris phlorophenone derivatives have been evaluated. The compounds tested comprised of monomeric acylphloroglucinols (e.g. desaspidinol, aspidinol) as well as dimeric (e.g. aspidin, desaspidin), trimeric (e.g. filixic acids), and tetrameric (e.g. dryocrassin) phlorophenone, wherein hexacyclic rings are bound together by a methylene bridge. These compounds were examined for their in vitro anti-tumor promoting effect on Epstein-Barr virus antigen activation induced by the tumor promoter 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate (TPA). The two dimeric compounds aspidin and desaspidin, which were found to be the most active among the tested phlorophenones, were also examined in vivo on two stage mouse skin carcinogenesis, and found to show significant inhibitory effect on 7,12-dimethylbenz[a]anthracene (DMBA)-TPA tumor promotion.

paper_title.en: 1-O-, 2-O- and 3-O-beta-glycosyl-sn-glycerols: Structure-anti-tumor-promoting activity relationship

description.en: The inhibitory activity of synthetic glycosylglycerols on Epstein-Barr virus early antigen (EBV-EA) activation was evaluated. Among the series of 1-O-, 2-O- and 3-O- glycosylglycerols rested, 1-O-beta-D-galactopyranosyl-sn-glycerol showed the highest inhibitory effect toward tumor promotion. (C) 1996. Elsevier Science Ltd

paper_title.en: Inhibitory effect of iridoids on Epstein-Barr virus activation by a short-term in vitro assay for anti-tumor promoters

description.en: The in vitro anti-tumor promoting effect of the methanolic extracts of iridoids containing three plants and several pure iridoids isolated from other plants, has been evaluated. The alcoholic extracts of Paederia scandens, P. scandens var. mairei and the Ayurvedic herbal remedy Picrorhiza kurrooa were tested against the Epstein-Barr virus. Among the 15 iridoids evaluated, the glycoside, paederoside, displayed the highest order of anti-tumor promoting activity.

paper_title.en: Inhibition of protein serine threonine phosphatases by fumonisin B-1, a mycotoxin

description.en: Fumonisin B-1 (FB1), a mycotoxin produced by the fungus Fusarium moniliforme, which is a common contaminant of corn, is suspected to be a cause of human esophageal cancer. FB1 is hepatotoxic and hepato-carcinogenic in rats, and although the mechanisms involved have not been clarified, the latter is associated with a weak initiating activity. The effects of FB, on the activity of protein serine/threonine phosphatases (PPs) (PP1, PP2A, PP2B, PP2C and PP5/T/K/H) were investigated in the present study. Inhibition of dephosphorylation was noted for all five PPs with IC50 values of 80 mu M-3000 mu M. Among the five PPs examined, PP5 was most sensitive with an IC50 of 80 mu M. This concentration is comparable to that estimated to be reached in the rat body by feeding FB, to obtain hepatic tumors. Inhibition of PP5 could thus play important roles in the toxicity and carcinogenic action of FB1. (C) 1996 Academic Press, Inc.

paper_title.en: Chemoprevention of lung and skin cancer by Beta vulgaris (beet) root extract

description.en: The in vitro inhibitory effect of Beta vulgaris (beet) root extract on Epstein-Barr virus early antigen (EBV-EA) induction using Raji cells revealed a high order of activity compared to capsanthin, cranberry, red onion skin and short and long red bell peppers. An in vivo anti-tumor promoting activity evaluation against the mice skin and lung bioassays also revealed a significant tumor inhibitory effect. The combined findings suggest that beetroot ingestion can be one of the useful means to prevent cancer.

paper_title.en: Anti-tumor-promoting activities of triterpenoids from Ferns. I.

paper_title.ja: Anti-Tumor-Promoting Activities of the Roots of Panax notoginseng (1) :
paper_title.en: Anti-tumor-promoting activities of the roots of Panax notoginseng(1).

description.ja: To search for possible anti-tumor-promoters and cancer chemopreventive agents, we carried out a primary screening of several Panax plants using an in vitro synergistic assay system. The MeOH extract of the root of Panax notoginseng exhibited a significant inhibitory effect on Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) activation induced by a tumor promoter, 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate (TPA). The major saponin of the roots of P. notoginseng, ginsenoside Rg_1, also exhibited a potent inhibitory effect on EBV activation. Furthermore, an extract of this plant exhibited the strong anti-tumor-promoting effects on the two-stage mouse skin (7,12-dimethyl-benz [a] anthracene as an initiator and TPA as a promoter), pulmonary (4-nitroquinoline-N-oxide as an initiator and glycerol as a promoter) and hepatic (N-nitrosodiethylamine as an initiator and phenobarbital as a promoter) carcinogenesis tests in vivo.
description.en: To search for possible anti-tumor-promoters and cancer chemopreventive agents, we carried out a primary screening of several Panax plants using an in vitro synergistic assay system. The MeOH extract of the root of Panax notoginseng exhibited a significant inhibitory effect on Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) activation induced by a tumor promoter, 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate (TPA). The major saponin of the roots of P. notoginseng, ginsenoside Rg_1, also exhibited a potent inhibitory effect on EBV activation. Furthermore, an extract of this plant exhibited the strong anti-tumor-promoting effects on the two-stage mouse skin (7,12-dimethyl-benz [a] anthracene as an initiator and TPA as a promoter), pulmonary (4-nitroquinoline-N-oxide as an initiator and glycerol as a promoter) and hepatic (N-nitrosodiethylamine as an initiator and phenobarbital as a promoter) carcinogenesis tests in vivo.

paper_title.en: Antitumor-promoting activity of various synthetic1-O-acyl-3-O-(6'-O-acyl-β-D-galactopyranosyl)-sn-glycerols related to natural product from freshwater cyanobacterium Anabaena flos-aquae f. flos-aquae.
Inhibition of 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate promoted mouse skin papillomas by digalactosyl diacylglycerol from the fresh water cyanobacterium Phormidium tenue.
Inhibitory effects of lantadenes and related triterpenoids on Epstein-Barr virus activation

description.en: To search for possible antitumor promoters, inhibitory effects of lantadenes and related triterpenoids from Lantana camara L. (Verbenaceae) on Epstein-Barr virus activation, were tested. The substitutions on the carboxylic acid through an ester bond might play an important role in the activity.
